snippet: The Shiite militia has been moving long-range missiles to Lebanon from bases inside Syria, according to an Israeli national security analyst, who said the missiles could strike deep inside his country.
abstract: Israeli national security analyst Ronen Bergman says Hezbollah has been moving long-range missiles to Lebanon from where it had stored them inside Syria, including those that can strike deep within Israel.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, and Eric Schmitt from Washington. Hwaida Saad contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The Shiite militia has been moving long-range missiles to Lebanon from bases inside Syria, according to an Israeli national security analyst, who said the missiles could strike deep inside his country.

headline.main: Hezbollah Moving Long-Range Missiles From Syria to Lebanon, an Analyst Says
headline.print_headline: Hezbollah Moving Long-Range Missiles From Syria to Lebanon, an Analyst Says

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
